context: COD measurements complied with the AFNOR NFT 90-101 standard. MLSS and MLVSS were characterized following, AFNOR 90-105 and AFNOR 90-029 standards respectively. Naphthalene (NAP) was purchased from Aldrich. Benzene (B), toluene (T), ethylbenzene (E), p-xylene (X), 2,4-dichlorophenol (DCP), 3,5-dimethylphenol (DMP), methanol, ethanol and acetate were all purchased from Sigma (more than 99% purity). The aromatic compounds concentrations in the liquid phase were evaluated by HS-GC–MS. In the GC–MS method, helium was used as a carrier gas at a column flow rate of 1.2 mL min−1. The injection port temperature was 250 °C and 1 mL of gas was injected in split mode (with a ratio of 1:20) for samples having concentrations greater than 1 ppm.

llm_generation.summary: In this context, ethylbenzene and 4-xylene are both mentioned as aromatic compounds purchased from Sigma with high purity for use in a study involving gas chromatography-mass spectrometry (GC-MS). However, there is no discussion of their specific interactions, roles, or relevance to each other beyond their classification as aromatic compounds and their inclusion in the same experimental setup.
llm_generation.reason: The score of 1 reflects a very low relationship, as ethylbenzene and 4-xylene are merely listed together as purchased chemicals without any direct interaction or functional relationship discussed in the context.
